definition: capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: China typically buys a fifth of the U.S. crop.
sentences.chinese: 中国大约采购美国总产量的五分之一。

sentences.english: The Chinese industry produces about half of these made in the world.
sentences.chinese: 中国生产的外置电源占全世界总产量的二分之一左右。

sentences.english: In the first half of this year the total coal output rose by eighty per cent as compared with that of last year.
sentences.chinese: 今年前半年煤炭总产量比去年增加了百分之八十。

sentences.english: The total output of pears in the village has reached one million tons.
sentences.chinese: 该乡的黄梨总产量高达一百万吨。

sentences.english: They already produce about 12 percent of all the world’s chemicals and fertilizers.
sentences.chinese: 其化工产品和化肥已经占世界总产量的大约12%。

sentences.english: Effects of phosphate significantly affected fruit yield and number of cladodes .
sentences.chinese: 磷肥施用量对红龙果果实总产量有显著影响。

sentences.english: China now produces one-third of the world's silicon wafers.
sentences.chinese: 中国目前的硅片产量占全球总产量的三分之一。

sentences.english: And the annual production of carrageenan has far exceeded the production of agar worldwide now.
sentences.chinese: 现在世界卡拉胶的年总产量已远远超过琼脂的产量。

sentences.english: Currently, 18% of total production is exported to over 125 countries.
sentences.chinese: 现在，总产量中18%的产品出口到125个国家。

sentences.english: China produces more than sixty percent of the world's farmed fish.
sentences.chinese: 中国养殖鱼产量超过了全球总产量的60%。

definition: to lose output/a drop in crop yield/reduction in production
remaining quantity/reserves (of natural resources, oil etc)
